image.altText: Heat makes for restless nights

props.synopsis: Public life ground to a halt, many lost power, and scores of people died behind closed doors. What sounds like the start of a post-apocalyptic movie is in fact Melbourne in January 2009.

title.children: 'Silent killer' heatwave was Australia's worst recent natural disaster

image.altText: Two men in ceremonial robes chat to each other

props.synopsis: After a year in which the royal family endured illness, conspiracy theories and embarrassing financial revelations, the last thing King Charles needed was a December surprise. But a scandal involving Prince Andrew and a foreign spy suggests the Windsors will not be able to leave the drama behind in 2025.

title.children: King Charles wanted a fresh start, but the year ended in a new scandal

image.altText: Australia cricketer Steve Smith stands in the outfield with a ball in front of his face.

props.synopsis: Australia's bowling attack may have to contend with regular rain delays on the penultimate day at the Gabba in its quest to dismiss India cheaply, twice, to win the third Test. Follow live.

title.children: Steve Smith drops a first-ball sitter with Australia desperate for clear skies and quick wickets at the Gabba

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Play will start at 9:50am AEST today

image.altText: Aboriginal dancer at Currumbin Sanctuary

props.synopsis: The Tourism office is slammed for spending three-quarters of its budget on contractors, with most of those contracts made through closed-door arrangements.

title.children: Tourism Australia spent three-quarters of its budget on contractors

image.altText: A green electric vehicle parked in an underground charging bay.

props.synopsis: Strata owners are increasingly banning electric vehicles from charging in basement carparks as fire safety authorities disagree over the risk of battery fires.

title.children: EVs in apartment carparks a battleground amid fight over right to charge

image.altText: Hugh Marks, Nine Entertainment chief executive

props.synopsis: Former Nine Entertainment chief executive Hugh Marks has been appointed as the new managing director of the ABC.

title.children: Former Nine boss Hugh Marks appointed ABC's new managing director

image.altText: A lake with lots of people swimming in the water or laying on the sand, amid the hot and sunny day with blue sky.

props.synopsis: Richmond and Penrith west of Sydney are expected to reach highs of 42 degrees Celsius today, and 40C in Campbelltown.

title.children: Emergency departments brace as Sydney endures scorching temperatures

image.altText: A woman wearing a black head covering with tears in her eyes

props.synopsis: More than 1 million Syrian refugees poured over the border into Lebanon during the country’s horrific civil war, and many are now considering returning.

title.children: Uncertainty for Syrian refugees waiting for safe return after Assad's fall

image.altText: A picture of a sunny resort in Fiji

props.synopsis: Investigations and toxicology tests are ongoing in Fiji after four Australian women who drank cocktails at a local resort were hospitalised.

title.children: Family holiday becomes 'worst nightmare' after Fiji alcohol poisoning

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging Q&A with the press in Florida, the president-elect talks about topics ranging from the Middle East to the future of TikTok.

title.children: Five takeaways from Trump's first post-election press conference

image.altText: A young woman in a blue shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Doctors have been urged to reconsider prescribing new patients crucial hormone replacement therapy amid a severe shortage that is leaving some women in a "constant state" of anxiety.

title.children: Doctors urged not to start new patients on HRT patches amid severe shortage

image.altText: The corporate logos of Ladbrokes and Neds betting agencies.

props.synopsis: AUSTRAC alleges Entain did not develop and maintain a compliant anti-money laundering program and failed to identify and assess the risks it faced, leaving the company at serious risk of criminal exploitation.

title.children: Owner of Ladbrokes and Neds sued for alleged anti-money laundering failure

image.altText: A close-up of solar panels on top of a house

props.synopsis: While Canberra has been locked in a pitched battle over climate and energy for 25 years, Australians have decided to go it alone, attaching solar panels to their roofs.

title.children: Dutton goes nuclear over energy costing assumptions

image.altText: Drone pics of the closed Mungar Rd bridge at Tiaro.

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been submerged by flash flooding overnight, with more rainfall predicted in the next 24 hours.

title.children: Flash flooding hits parts of Queensland as extreme heatwave warning issued

image.altText: A photo of Roger Hearn in Gaza standing outside a building with blue arabic writing.

props.synopsis: As director of relief, Roger Hearn was responsible for organising the distribution of food from aid trucks coming in through the border. But what depressed him the most was being unable to bring in enough food to help feed Gaza's 1.9 million internally displaced people.

title.children: Australian UNRWA head saw 'dystopian disaster' of starving kids in Gaza

image.altText: A blue screen with green and red stocks at the Australian Securities Exchange 29.8.21

props.synopsis: The ASX may open lower, continuing a five-session losing streak. Wall Street resumes its rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nasdaq, Bitcoin hit fresh records, ASX to dip

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX opens slightly higher despite energy stocks sliding
Trump's 'strategic reserve' comment fuels yet another bitcoin super rally
Nasdaq and Bitcoin accelerate to new records, ASX stuck in neutral

image.altText: Aboriginal woman in purple shirt sitting in chair

props.synopsis: When the ABC visited Alpurrurulam, a tiny outback town on the Northern Territory-Queensland border, all anyone in town wanted to talk about was what was happening at the local school.

title.children: Allegations of bullying and inappropriate behaviour at outback school

image.altText: Two men smiling on a red backdrop of a city skyline

props.synopsis: Never before in Australia has a state government had so much political power with so much wealth at its disposal. What does Labor have to show for its total control?

title.children: WA Labor's report card after four years of total control

image.altText: Prince Andrew stands outside Westminster Abbey at the thanksgiving service for Prince Philip.

props.synopsis: Yang Tengbo denies he is a spy and says he is a victim of a changing political landscape between the UK and China.

title.children: Alleged Chinese spy with links to Prince Andrew named

image.altText: A close up on a two-month-old baby's face, with its right hand on its cheek.

props.synopsis: The family of a baby injured in a shocking home invasion in Alice Springs thanks the community for its support after a fundraiser drew more than $52,000 in donations.

title.children: Alice Springs raises $52K for baby injured in home invasion

image.altText: Marked and unmarked police cars on a street

props.synopsis: A shooting at a private Christian school in the US state of Wisconsin leaves three people dead, including a child who caused the attack, according to authorities.

title.children: Three dead including shooter in Wisconsin school attack

image.altText: A graphic of a house that is similar to a dolls house with a for sale sign out the front

props.synopsis: Are you affected by the housing crisis in Australia? The issue could be pivotal in next year's federal election and ABC News is asking you to share your housing story.

title.children: We want to hear how Australia's housing crisis has impacted you. Share your story

image.altText: Photo of a machine spreading human waste.

props.synopsis: A Sydney Water document reveals sewage by-products used in food production contain elevated levels of PFAS.

title.children: Sewage by-products used on farms contaminated with 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A young woman smiles. She wears headphones around her neck.

props.synopsis: Vanessa Mbeve spent more than a decade hiding away from the world, unhappy with the way cerebral palsy affected her. Now, at 26, she's breaking free from self-imposed shackles.

title.children: After many years withdrawing into my own world, I stepped out

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: In addition to increasing funding for the ABC, Labor says it will seek to legislate five-year funding terms for the ABC and SBS to help prevent "political interference".

title.children: Government announces $40m a year funding boost for ABC

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Dozens of tree logs surrounding a large harvesting machine

props.synopsis: The NSW native logging industry is not "economically viable" and the state government should consider shutting it down after 2028 if its prospects do not improve, an independent economic regulator has recommended.

title.children: NSW's native forest logging industry ruled not 'economically viable'

image.altText: Middle aged man with glasses looking out with a stained glass window behind him.

props.synopsis: An Anglican, a Baptist, a Catholic, and a Lutheran attend the final service at this outback church. It's not the start of a joke but a show of solidarity in a small town losing a historic building, among a growing trend of church closures in Australia.

title.children: Outback church up for sale as bills increase but attendance shrinks

image.altText: Man with beard sitting in wheeled amusement park ride

props.synopsis: Granties Maze owner John Grant says he will fight a court order to dismantle dozens of rides at his NSW south coast attraction.

title.children: Owner of $10 million fun park ordered to scrap 'unsafe' rides

image.altText: A man in a black suit bites his finger

props.synopsis: Germany's parliament has accepted Chancellor Olaf Scholz's invitation to withdraw its confidence in him and his government, clearing the way for an early February election.

title.children: Germans set for snap election as parliament rescinds chancellor trust

image.altText: A blonde woman throwing a yellow banana milkshake in the face of Nigel Farage standing in a group of people

props.synopsis: Victoria Thomas Bowen, 25, was seen throwing a large milkshake over the politician during this year's UK election campaign.

title.children: Woman who threw milkshake at Nigel Farage handed jail sentence

image.altText: Two men sit on an outdoor bench looking serious.

props.synopsis: Child sexual abuse survivors will meet with Queensland's attorney-general to discuss scrapping good character references for convicted sex offenders in the state's legal system.

title.children: Campaign to ban character references for sex offenders comes to Queensland

image.altText: A teenage girl in school uniform stands with her arm around an elderly lady.

props.synopsis: Denise Walker started teaching in the 1960s, while also blazing the way as a female pilot in regional NSW. Her students say she brings joy to the classroom.

title.children: 83yo teacher signs on for another year after six decades in the job
